aws-credentials.name: AWS Credentials
aws-credentials.description:
Block used to manage authentication with AWS. AWS authentication is
handled via the `boto3` module. Refer to the
[boto3 docs](https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/guide/credentials.html)
for more info about the possible credential configurations. This block is part of the prefect-aws collection. Install prefect-aws with `pip install prefect-aws` to use this block.
aws-credentials.code_example:
Load stored AWS credentials:
```python
from prefect_aws import AwsCredentials

aws_credentials_block = AwsCredentials.load("BLOCK_NAME")
```

fields.description:
Block used to manage authentication with AWS. AWS authentication is
handled via the `boto3` module. Refer to the
[boto3 docs](https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/guide/credentials.html)
for more info about the possible credential configurations.

aws_access_key_id.description: A specific AWS access key ID.
aws_access_key_id.title: AWS Access Key ID

aws_secret_access_key.description: A specific AWS secret access key.
aws_secret_access_key.title: AWS Access Key Secret

aws_session_token.description: The session key for your AWS account. This is only needed when you are using temporary credentials.
aws_session_token.title: AWS Session Token

profile_name.description: The profile to use when creating your session.
profile_name.title: Profile Name

region_name.description: The AWS Region where you want to create new connections.
region_name.title: Region Name

aws_client_parameters.description: Extra parameters to initialize the Client.
aws_client_parameters.title: AWS Client Parameters

fields.title: AwsCredentials

AwsClientParameters.description:
Model used to manage extra parameters that you can pass when you initialize
the Client. If you want to find more information, see
[boto3 docs](https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/reference/core/session.html)
for more info about the possible client configurations.

Attributes:
    api_version: The API version to use. By default, botocore will
        use the latest API version when creating a client. You only need
        to specify this parameter if you want to use a previous API version
        of the client.
    use_ssl: Whether or not to use SSL. By default, SSL is used.
        Note that not all services support non-ssl connections.
    verify: Whether or not to verify SSL certificates. By default
        SSL certificates are verified. If False, SSL will still be used
        (unless use_ssl is False), but SSL certificates
        will not be verified. Passing a file path to this is deprecated.
    verify_cert_path: A filename of the CA cert bundle to
        use. You can specify this argument if you want to use a
        different CA cert bundle than the one used by botocore.
    endpoint_url: The complete URL to use for the constructed
        client. Normally, botocore will automatically construct the
        appropriate URL to use when communicating with a service. You
        can specify a complete URL (including the "http/https" scheme)
        to override this behavior. If this value is provided,
        then ``use_ssl`` is ignored.
    config: Advanced configuration for Botocore clients. See
        [botocore docs](https://botocore.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/reference/config.html)
        for more details.

use_ssl.description: Whether or not to use SSL.
use_ssl.title: Use SSL

verify.description: Whether or not to verify SSL certificates.
verify.title: Verify

verify_cert_path.description: Path to the CA cert bundle to use.
verify_cert_path.title: Certificate Authority Bundle File Path

endpoint_url.description: The complete URL to use for the constructed client.
endpoint_url.title: Endpoint URL

AwsClientParameters.title: AwsClientParameters

aws-secret.name: AWS Secret
aws-secret.description: Manages a secret in AWS's Secrets Manager. This block is part of the prefect-aws collection. Install prefect-aws with `pip install prefect-aws` to use this block.
aws-secret.code_example:
```python
from prefect_aws.secrets_manager import AwsSecret

aws_secret_block = AwsSecret.load("BLOCK_NAME")
```

fields.description: Manages a secret in AWS's Secrets Manager.
fields.title: AwsSecret

    use_ssl: Whether or not to use SSL. By default, SSL is used.

lambda-function.name: Lambda Function
lambda-function.description:
Invoke a Lambda function. This block is part of the prefect-aws
collection. Install prefect-aws with `pip install prefect-aws` to use this
block. This block is part of the prefect-aws collection. Install prefect-aws with `pip install prefect-aws` to use this block.
lambda-function.code_example:
```python
from prefect_aws.lambda_function import LambdaFunction

lambda_function_block = LambdaFunction.load("BLOCK_NAME")
```

fields.description:
Invoke a Lambda function. This block is part of the prefect-aws
collection. Install prefect-aws with `pip install prefect-aws` to use this
block.

function_name.description: The name, ARN, or partial ARN of the Lambda function to run. This must be the name of a function that is already deployed to AWS Lambda.
function_name.title: Function Name

qualifier.description: The version or alias of the Lambda function to use when invoked. If not specified, the latest (unqualified) version of the Lambda function will be used.
qualifier.title: Qualifier

aws_credentials.description: The AWS credentials to invoke the Lambda with.
aws_credentials.title: AWS Credentials

fields.title: LambdaFunction

minio-credentials.name: MinIO Credentials
minio-credentials.description: Block used to manage authentication with MinIO. Refer to the MinIO docs: https://docs.min.io/docs/minio-server-configuration-guide.html for more info about the possible credential configurations. This block is part of the prefect-aws collection. Install prefect-aws with `pip install prefect-aws` to use this block.
minio-credentials.code_example:
Load stored MinIO credentials:
```python
from prefect_aws import MinIOCredentials

minio_credentials_block = MinIOCredentials.load("BLOCK_NAME")
```

fields.description: Block used to manage authentication with MinIO. Refer to the MinIO docs: https://docs.min.io/docs/minio-server-configuration-guide.html for more info about the possible credential configurations.

region_name.title: Region Name

s3-bucket.name: S3 Bucket
s3-bucket.description: Block used to store data using AWS S3 or S3-compatible object storage like MinIO. This block is part of the prefect-aws collection. Install prefect-aws with `pip install prefect-aws` to use this block.
s3-bucket.code_example:
```python
from prefect_aws.s3 import S3Bucket

s3_bucket_block = S3Bucket.load("BLOCK_NAME")
```

fields.description: Block used to store data using AWS S3 or S3-compatible object storage like MinIO.

credentials.description: A block containing your credentials to AWS or MinIO.
credentials.title: Credentials

bucket_folder.description: A default path to a folder within the S3 bucket to use for reading and writing objects.
bucket_folder.title: Bucket Folder

fields.title: S3Bucket
